section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Post Secondary Colleges Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Constitution
section.leadIn: The constitution of every College shall include the following provisions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following college bodies shall be constituted—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a Board of Governors which shall be the supreme governing body of the College;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: an Academic Board which shall regulate the academic affairs of the College subject to the financial control of the College Council; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a Faculty Board for each faculty in the College which shall be responsible to the Academic Board for the teaching and general organization of the courses assigned to that faculty reporting thereon from time to time to the Academic Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the College bodies specified in paragraph (a) shall be subject to the provisions in Table A relating to composition and standing orders—

tr.td: Not less than 10 nor more than 40.
The Chairman may convene at any time and shall do so on written request of 5 members.
Not less than 10 members nor more than 25.
The Chairman may convene at any time and shall do so on written request of 5 members.
The Chairman may convene at any time.
The Dean of each Faculty to be Chairman of the Board of that Faculty.

paragraph.name: c

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: a committee established under subparagraph (i) may be constituted partly of persons who are not members of the particular College body establishing it;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: there shall be the following officers—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a President who shall be the principal academic and administrative officer, and who shall be appointed and dismissed by the Board of Governors on the advice of the College Council subject to the approval of the Permanent Secretary; (3 of 2003 s. 27)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a Vice-President;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a Chairman and Vice-Chairman of the Board of Governors;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a Chairman and Vice-Chairman of the College Council;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a Chairman and Vice-Chairman of the Academic Board;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: a Dean for each Faculty in the College;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: an Academic Registrar;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: a Bursar;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: a Librarian;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: a Dean of Studies;

subparagraph.name: xi
subparagraph.content: a Registrar;

subparagraph.name: xii
subparagraph.content: a Librarian;

subparagraph.name: xiii
subparagraph.content: a Comptroller;

subparagraph.name: xiv
subparagraph.content: a Dean of Students;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: all the officers specified in subparagraphs (vi) to (xiv) in paragraph (e) shall be appointed and dismissed by the College Council subject to the approval of the Board of Governors;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: teachers shall be classified as senior lecturers, lecturers, assistant lecturers, tutors and demonstrators; and such persons shall be appointed by the College Council on recommendations of the Academic Board subject to the approval of the Board of Governors;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: the minimum qualification of a teacher shall be a university degree;

subparagraph.name: iv
i
subparagraph.content: application for any person to be entered on the register of members of Boards of Governors or of members of College Councils shall be made to the Permanent Secretary by the Chairman of the Board of Governors on the instructions of the majority of the same of the prescribed form; (See Form 2)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: application for any person to be entered on the register of teachers shall be made to the Permanent Secretary by the President subject to the approval of the College Council on the prescribed form; (See Form 3) (3 of 2003 s. 27)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the College Council shall appoint as auditor a certified public accountant (practising) as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588), who shall audit the College accounts annually, and who shall hold office for 1 year but shall be eligible for re-appointment. (76 of 1973 s. 3; 23 of 2004 s. 56; E.R. 2 of 2019; L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: College premises shall at all times to the satisfaction of the Permanent Secretary or any person authorized by him in writing in that behalf— (3 of 2003 s. 27)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be kept in a state of repair, cleanliness and safety;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be adequately ventilated, lighted and provided with satisfactory water supply and with washing and latrine arrangements;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be adequately protected against fire and equipped with fire fighting appliances.

subsection.content: College hostels shall be provided with adequate sick rooms and all boarders shall be medically examined by a registered medical practitioner before admission to any College hostel and re-examined at least once in every 6 months thereafter.
The Permanent Secretary or any person authorized by him in writing in that behalf may require any person employed in a College and any teacher or student to be medically examined.

The College Council shall, if so required in writing by the Permanent Secretary or any person authorized by him in writing in that behalf, cause any employee, teacher or student found to be suffering from an infectious disease to be excluded from the College for such period as he may direct.

The College shall provide adequate first aid equipment, and in particular there shall be first aid boxes adjacent to all laboratories and workshops, and the staff shall be familiar with the contents and use of such first aid boxes.
The College Council shall ensure that no student performs dangerous experiments or uses dangerous equipment without adequate supervision.
Poisons, dangerous chemicals and other dangerous equipment shall be properly guarded and under the charge of a responsible member of the College staff.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Admission and age of entry of students

subsection.content: No student shall be admitted to a College unless he is at least 17 years of age.

The minimum academic requirement for entry into a College shall, save where the Permanent Secretary or any person authorized by him in writing in that behalf otherwise permits, be the possession of a Hong Kong School Certificate or Hong Kong Chinese School Certificate. (3 of 2003 s. 27)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Permission required for courses for teachers
section.text: No College shall give a course of training for teachers, except with the written permission of the Chief Executive.

subsection.content: Examinations for degrees, diplomas and certificates of a College shall be conducted by examiners appointed by the College Council on the recommendation of the Academic Board.

The Permanent Secretary or any person authorized by him in writing in that behalf shall have the right to nominate, if he so wishes, additional examiners for any examination for a degree, diploma or certificate of a College. (3 of 2003 s. 27)
The College Council shall ensure the keeping of correct and adequate accounts of all income and expenditure of the College.
All books of accounts, receipts, vouchers, etc., shall be open to inspection by the Permanent Secretary or any person authorized by him in writing in that behalf. (3 of 2003 s. 27)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Forms
section.content: Applications for registration of a Post Secondary College, for registration of a member of the Board of Governors or member of a College Council, or for registration of a teacher shall be made on the forms set out in the Schedule.

schedule.name: sch0
schedule.text: (Chapter 320)Application to register a college as an approved Post Secondary College

paragraph.content: I hereby apply for registration of the college, particulars of which are set out below, as an approved Post Secondary College.

tr.td: Sources and amount of annual revenue other than fees
Amount of capital funds available for building and equipment or already spent for such purposes
Name and address of lessee of college premises
Number of teaching weeks in academic year
Number of students it is proposed to admit per annum
Total number of students for which the College will provide
Names of proposed Faculties and Departments in each Faculty

paragraph.content: I attach applications in duplicate for the persons listed in Appendix A to be registered as a Member of the Board of Governors of the College.
I attach applications in duplicate for the persons listed in Appendix B to be registered as Members of the College Council.
I attach applications in duplicate for the persons listed in Appendix C to be registered as teachers.
I attach particulars (including salaries) of all officers it is proposed to appoint.
I attach 3 copies of a rough plan or diagram of the college premises (with dimensions).
I attach a list of proposed courses and outline contents and length of each course.
I attach a copy of the Conditions of Service and Contract for Employment of a full-time teacher of the College.
I attach a copy of the Requirements for Admission of a student to the College.
I attach a copy of the Ordinance incorporating the College or other evidence of incorporation together with a copy of the Constitution of the College.
I attach a general account of the proposed conduct, organization, courses and finance of the College.
The Board of Governors request approval for the appointment of . as President.

center.i: Chairman of the Board of Governors

tr.td: Registration of a college does not release the Board of Governors or any other person from compliance with any relevant requirements of the Buildings Ordinance (Chapter 123) or any other Ordinance, nor does it in any way affect or modify any agreements or covenants whatsoever relating to the premises intended for use as the college.
